meanings.definition: The act of pulling up or out by the roots.
meanings.sent1: The gardener performed extirpation on the stubborn weed in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The extirpation of the tree roots was necessary to prevent damage to the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: During the extirpation process, the weed put up a fight!
meanings.sent4: The extirpation of the invasive plant was like removing a deeply embedded memory.
meanings.sent5: The extirpation of the roots was a satisfying task, like solving a puzzle.

meanings.definition: The complete destruction or eradication of something.
meanings.sent1: The wildfire caused the extirpation of the entire forest.
meanings.sent2: The extirpation of the old building made way for a new park.
meanings.sent3: The extirpation of the cake at the party was swift and thorough.
meanings.sent4: The extirpation of the virus from the computer system was a relief.
meanings.sent5: The extirpation of the old tradition shocked the community.

meanings.definition: The removal or extermination of a population or species.
meanings.sent1: The extirpation of the invasive species saved the local ecosystem.
meanings.sent2: The extirpation of the pests from the crops increased the yield.
meanings.sent3: The extirpation of the noisy neighbors was a welcome change.
meanings.sent4: The extirpation of the rare bird species was a tragic loss.
meanings.sent5: The extirpation of the fish population had a ripple effect on the entire food chain.
